physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Numerous basal cell carcinomas (BCCs) predominantly on sun-exposed skin; associated with jaw cysts, typical facies with broad nasal root and hypertelorism. Other features include palmoplantar pits, epidermal cysts, intracranial calcifications, kyphoscoliosis, and pectus excavatum.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial development of BCCs at 16 years, with progression noted over time and numerous lesions requiring various treatments (cryotherapy, excision). Later diagnosis of adenoid cystic carcinoma with metastatic progression.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: New mass in the right hard palate diagnosed as adenoid cystic carcinoma with perineural lymphatic invasion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Adenoid cystic carcinoma progressed to involve regional lymph nodes 16 months post-surgery. Follow-up examinations revealed distant pulmonary metastases.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bone scan showed metastatic disease in ribs and sternum, later confirmed by chest radiograph that revealed metastatic disease to lungs.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial treatment with chemotherapy showed no response, indicated progressive disease on follow-up imaging including MRI.
